pages.title: Orbital Scan #0082
pages.text: $(bold)Subject: Best of Both Worlds$()$(br2)Orbital engineering had a thought: "What if the field operative puts the thing that stops frostbite $(italic)inside$() the thing that stops suffocation?"$(br2)They ran simulations for three days. The answer was yes.$(br2)The $(bold)Acheronite-Lined EVA Suit$() combines the atmospheric protection of the Mk.III EVA with the frostbite immunity of Acheronite armor. It is, objectively, the best thing ORSA has ever designed. From orbit. Without testing it.$(br2)$(italic)"Better than the orbital stabilizer?"$(br)"The one that failed and caused the apocalypse? Yes. Better than that." â€” ORSA Engineering$()

pages.title: Properties
pages.text: $(bold)Combines:$()$(br)$(li)EVA suit atmospheric protection$(li)Acheronite frostbite immunity$(li)Maximum cold resistance$(br2)This is endgame gear. If you've built this, you've essentially told the apocalypse to go away. It won't, but at least you'll be comfortable while it doesn't.$(br2)$(bold)Note:$() Only the chestplate can be lined. ORSA ran out of simulation time. And funding. The funding mostly went to the coffee machine on the station.

pages.title: Acheronite-Lined EVA Suit
pages.text: Surround an EVA chestplate with Refined Acheronite. The suit will resist. Push harder.
